titleStmt.title: [Legal Inventory of Estate] 1840, June 5 and 1841, Jan. 29, Dickson County, Tennessee [of] Walter Bell / [signed by] A. Caldwell, Gilford Mills, and W.T. Reynolds : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Legal Inventory of Estate] 1840, June 5 and 1841, Jan. 29, Dickson County, Tennessee [of] Walter Bell / [signed by] A. Caldwell, Gilford Mills, and W.T. Reynolds
bibl.note: These are two documents. One is a list of the perishable items of Walter Bell's estate, dated June 5, 1840. The other is a statement giving the value of his real estate, dated Jan. 29, 1841. The total value of the Bell estate, including perishable items, is set at $3,063.55.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

opener.add: Perishable Property BB6-2 Inventory of Walter Bell's Estate
opener.name: Dickson County
State of Tennessee

div1.p:
We the undersigned by request of William B Bell Administrator of Walter Bell Dec'd have proceeded to value the perishable property of the said Walter Bell Dec'd and to assess the value to be Thirteen Hundred Sixty three Dollars 55 cents as the following list will Show.
Valuation of the perishable property of Walter Bell Dec'd
Viz. 42 head of sheep at 125 cents each52.50
5 cows & calves50.00
2 Steers & 1 dry cow30.00
2 Steers & 2 heiffers25.00
5 yearlings17.50
115 head of hogs at 150 at 150 each172.50
30 Shoots at 50 cents each15.00
2000 lbs of bacon at 7 cts per lb140.00
32 bu of wheat at 4 cts per bu12.80
15 barrels of corn at 125 cents per br18.75
4 Set of gear complete9.00
4 ploughs8.00
1 harrow with iron teeth2.00
1 waggon50.00
1 gray horse60.00
1 gray do50.00
1 bay mare & colt75.00
1 bay mare75.00
1 gray filly 2 years old50.00
1 bay horse do45.00
958.05
The amount brought over958.05
1 bay yearling horse colt15.00
12 geese4.50
8 turkeys3.00
8 feather beds & furniture200.00
6 common bedsteads10.00
1 press & furniture45.75
1 folding table injured2.50
2 common poplar tables .75
1 long table4.00
12 win⁁dsor chairs12.00
5 common do1.25
lot weeding hoes & 2 falling axes4.00
kitchen furniture27.00
1 flax wheel & check reel3.75
1 lot of books72.00
1363.55

This day we the undersigners have proceeded to value the real estate of Walter Bell Dec'd and do assess the value thereof to Seventeen Hundred Dollars together with the former valuation done by us on the 5th of June 1840 of the perishable property Walter Bell Dec'd of Thirteen Hundred and Sixty three Dollars 55 cents making in the whole three Thousand Sixty three 55 cents to the which valuation to the best of our knowledge
we sign our names and affix our seals
day and date above written
